metadata.title: CVE-2023-25012 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The Linux kernel through 6.1.9 has a Use-After-Free in bigben_remove indrivers/hid/hid-bigbenff.c via a crafted USB device because the LEDcontrollers remain registered for too long.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25012` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1005-dell300x - 4.15.0-1005.8
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-gcp - 4.15.0-1071.81
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1077.82
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
